author: José Salavert Torres

text:
I love that Portrait of Ruin's soundtrack sounds so much different off of the DS speakers.  It's like listening to a new soundtrack all over again.  

Let's hope Igavania turns out well, because there aren't many more people I know quite so bummed about Konami pulling the crap they have in the last year.  It's like a Capcom-tier "piss off" in the heart.
author: Honatuto

text: Good, but the Harmony of Despair version of this Song is better.

author: Ahmed360

text: Good soundtrack. Yamane always delivers.
author: jb1980ist

text:
I actually have infuriating memories of this game. For whatever reason, sometimes when I was walking from room to room in the Nation of Fools the game would freeze completely save for the music. And save points on that area were not well distributed sadly. I have no clue if that ever happened to anyone else.

That aside, I really like this game. The tag mechanic was interesting and the areas varied a lot.
author: Lucas

text: The original had some freezing glitches, most frequently when both partners were trying to use abilities, or when using Charlotte and attempting to quick-summon Jonathan for a throw.  It's been that way since launch, unfortunately; make sure you save frequently, more so than any other CV.
author: Honatuto

text: It's good hearing this track without "JONATHAN! CHARLOTTE! JONATHAN!" getting screamed at me every few minutes.
author: JayMoyles

text: Wow. Definitely sounds like something that would be near the end of the game. Love it. Also reminds me that I need to play these IgaVania games..
author: Aegis29

text: Although my favourite Casltevania on DS is OoE n, PoR was a great game, with inovations, memorable boss fights, levels and gameplay. The manga esthetic inherited from DoS was the only flaw, and I'm glad they adopted a more adult design in OoE

text: This game was pretty fun. And being able to play as Maria again made it even better.

text:

text: +Alfonso ST I mastered the game multiple times in every way possible without taking a single hit. I loved every minute of it, though.
author: genesisSOC

text: Been watching a lot of Jojos Bizarre Adventure and the there is a passage in [The End of the World] that sounds so much like Castlevania. A bit like this song too, yet i haven't found the exact Castlevania song that it reminds me of.
author: Rhodan

text: +Rhodan Authors from End of the world said that they were really inspired by clock towers theme from Castlevania. You can see those similarities with all those kogs and pendulums
author: Tristan Hakaize

text: +Minako Takehori It's weird how first Jojo inspires Castlevania and then Castlevania inspires Jojo
author: Rhodan

text: Everything always go in circle with Jojo
author: Tristan Hakaize

text: 8 years since the last Igavania, I definitely have an itch for more. With the series mostly dead thanks to Konami's amazing (mis)management, I can only thank programs like Kickstarter for existing and giving us the chance to play games like Bloodstained, Iga's next project.
author: SupraDarky
